data.title: Great
data.text: Excellent food and equally good brew! Food menu is limited but food is consistently good. Bar tenders are knowledgeable and helpful with drink selection. Plenty of opportunity to sample a beer before you order a pint. Would recommend.

data.title: cool open concept brew pub
data.text: high ceilings, lots of well spaced seating other then at the wrap around bar.  good beers made on site and nice sandwiches for luncy.

data.title: Micro brews & wine & cocktails
data.text: Nice place. Friendly staff.Great food! Can accommodate groups. Our party of 7 had a variety of good and all was very good.

data.title: Good beer, good food
data.text: The brewing company was busy on a Friday night, but we got a table quickly and were addressed just as quickly.  There were lots of choices for beers, so we found a couple that were good. The burgers were large and a bit dry. Probably our fault for ordering them well done. Very comfortable and spacious feeling. Recommend!

data.title: Food just ok
data.text: Plank town has great potential but the food is just ok. We had a veg omelette and smoked salmon Benedict.  The poached eggs were not drained properly and the plate was full of water. The omelette had hard pieces of asparagus in it. The catchup was not normal and the butter was odd too. They are trying to be fancy Nuevo, but fell short.

data.title: Great food and great beer!
data.text: We visited Plankhouse on our vacation in Eugene. In our group of six friends, we had several different meals and several different beers, including samplers. Every person ranted and raved about their food and beers. I had a burger and I can honestly say it was one of the best I have ever had.  The service was excellent and the bar/restaurant was pleasant.  If we lived closer, we would definitely be coming here on a regular basis. Highly recommend!

data.title: Great food for a pub
data.text:
First of all Plank Town is a cool place.   Nice old building, nice open space inside, friendly staff, refreshing lack of hipsters, no TV.   One of the best pubs I've been in.
The menu is more imaginative than you normally see in a pub.   They go beyond burgers and have really nice sandwiches with interesting ingredients.  For example pulled pork with green apples and smoked lamb with raspberry BBQ sauce.  Non bread options include tacos and of all things a smoked cod potato salad on kale.  You get the idea.  Portions are huge and a bargain at preteen prices. 
The beer is fine with plenty of choices.  The barrel aged Blue Pool is mighty fine.

data.title: Upscale brewpub with unique menu
data.text: While staying overnight in Springfield, we were looking for a new dining experience.  We favor brewpubs and were fortunate to find this one in the downtown area, only 3 miles from our hotel.  There is clearly something for everyone here because we saw couples, young and older, families, singles, and all seemed to be thoroughly enjoying themselves.  We ordered a couple of beers (and a tasting menu of beers later for dessert) with a smoked salmon salad for me and a Cuban sandwich for my husband.  Both were delicious.  It was a refreshing change from the usual heavy-on-fried-foods menus we often find at brewpubs.  Service was pleasant, but a little disjointed because our server seemed a little overwhelmed trying to serve both inside and patio tables.  Otherwise, a great choice.

data.title: Food worth going out of your way
data.text: Had flank steak with a hash made of hominy, yams and small bits of baby kale. I like unusual combinations so this was great for me. Husband had a burger (his usual) and this one was huge, meat lightly packed and he said was one of the best he ever had. Employees were helpful and professional.

data.title: Best Waiter
data.text: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our meal at Plank Town. I started out with The McKenzie martini. It had 3 things in it that I have never heard before, but I enjoyed it! We weren't all that hungry so we shared a couple things. We started out with the calamari appetizer/aioli dip. Very good and healthy portion. We then split the blue cheese mushroom burger which was also delicious. We really enjoyed our server Darren who had just relocated to Oregon from Santa Cruz. He was a total delight and wish him the best on his plans to open a restaurant in Germany some day!

data.title: Good Experience
data.text: Went here for supper one evening.   Got a 4 beer sampler- not impressed with any of them (but I am usually not- I like only a few standards).  Had other samplers so may have to try them all until I find one that fits my PICKY tastebuds.  Food was good.  Will eat here again if time- WAY too many breweries in town to fit in while here.

data.title: Brewery and Burgers
data.text: Microbrews and good food in a somewhat rustic  setting . Right in downtown Springfield very close to the Simpson's mural. Yep, THAT Springfield,lol.

data.title: Must try food and brew in Springifeld
data.text:
Fabulous burgers, and outstanding service make this place one of the best in Springfield.  We've never had a bad experience in the 7+ times we've been here, and I doubt that is a fluke.  Good drink selection and great deal on Mondays for burgers and a beer 🍺 for only $1 (with burger purchase). 

Well worth trying whether for family, business, or solo lunch.  Love all the wait staff but ask for Lisa she's been our fav so far.

data.title: More light fare options
data.text: Most of the time I can't eat an entire meal and really appreciate when lighter fare options are offered. We got a few different appetizers to celebrate boss's birthday, and I didn't have to order a large meal... win-win!

data.title: Downtown
data.text: Great place for sunday breakfast or weekend lunch. We have been there several times including a pub tour. Good food and microbrews.

data.title: It's busy all the time
data.text: Someone must like them we don't food is strange and not what we normally eat staff was not very friendly will not go back I don't know what else to tell you it just wasn't for us

data.title: Good food, great staff!
data.text:
I had dinner here with my husband and mother. The food was good, and the wait staff was super friendly and helpful. The ambiance was nice - love the decor - though it was a tad loud inside. 

I often see the place as I drive by, and people are outside enjoying the sidewalk seating - though it is on main street, so if a constant stream of slow-moving traffic would bother you, you'll want to sit inside.

data.title: Wonderful !!
data.text:
What a fun place!    Outdoor seating out in front was our choice.    Excellent service, and the food was a refreshing change.  Not your typical bar/brewery food.   Lots of healthy but appetizing choices.  The burgers are big and different, not typical either.   Their bier choices were plenty!  

They have plenty of seating inside for small or large groups.   Also kid friendly.

I highly recommend this place, and will visit often during my 7 month stay in Eugene.

data.title: Good beer selection
data.text: Stopped over after a day at the Trials. The place was not overly busy and we were greeted by a friendly waiter. The beer selection is quite broad and we enjoyed the ones we had. The food was good as well. The one rub was the speed of the food being served. Again, the place had plenty of open tables but it still took 45 minutes for the food. Fortunately, we were not pressed for time and used the wait to try various brews. So, a good place to go if you aren't pressed for time.

data.title: Fantastic place
data.text:
The place is a amazing. Great menu, great food, great beers and ciders, and an outside patio. The service is friendly and efficient.
We had the pork verde enchiladas, the cauliflower gratin and a cheesecake - everything was done to perfection.
Highly recommended.
